description: The cluster dashboard displays the latest configurations, resources status and usages percent of the clusters entities.

panels.content: ###### The cluster dashboard displays the latest configurations, resources status and usage percent of the clusters entities.

panels.description: Number of hosts in the cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR3 - This query returns the
-- number of hosts and the number of vms
-- in the latest cluster configuration

-- This query returns the number of active hosts in a chosen cluster
SELECT
    COUNT ( DISTINCT v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id ) AS host_count
FROM 
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_vms
        ON 
            (
                v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id =
                v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.cluster_id
            )
WHERE
    --Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )

panels.title: Number of Hosts (DR3)

panels.description: Number of virtual machines in the cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR3 - This query returns the
-- number of hosts and the number of vms
-- in the latest cluster configuration

-- This query returns the number of active vms in a chosen cluster
SELECT
    COUNT ( DISTINCT v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id ) AS vm_count
FROM 
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_vms
        ON 
            (
                v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id =
                v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.cluster_id
            )
WHERE
    --Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )

panels.title: Number of Virtual Machines (DR3)

panels.description: Average uptime percent for the hosts in the specific cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR6 - This query returns the average
-- uptime percent for the hosts in the specific cluster

SELECT
    (
        -- Here we sum the total uptime
        SUM 
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
                        THEN COALESCE ( v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        /
        -- Here we sum the total time
        SUM 
            (
                v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status
            )
    ) * 100 AS uptime_mins_percent
FROM 
    v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
        ON 
            (
                v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )

panels.title: Cluster Host Uptime (DR6)

panels.description: Average percentage of CPU usage for all hosts in the selected cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR12 - This query returns the average
-- resources that are used ( cpu and memory )
-- for the hosts in the specific cluster

SELECT
    cpu_usage_percent_avg AS average_cpu_used
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            AVG ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_usage_percent_avg
        FROM 
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
            INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                        v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we get only active hosts
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
            AND v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
    ) AS average_cpu_percent

panels.title: Cluster Host CPU Usage (DR12)

panels.description: Average percentage of memory usage for all hosts in the selected cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR12 - This query returns the average
-- resources that are used ( cpu and memory )
-- for the hosts in the specific cluster

SELECT
    memory_usage_percent_avg AS average_memory_used
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            AVG ( memory_usage_percent ) AS memory_usage_percent_avg
        FROM 
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
            INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                        v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we get only active hosts
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
            AND v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
    ) AS average_memory_percent

panels.title: Cluster Host Memory Usage (DR12)

panels.description: Uptime percent of high availability virtual machines.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR13 - This query returns the
-- uptime percent of high availability vms
-- for the specific cluster

SELECT
    (
        -- Here we sum the total uptime
        SUM
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_status = 1
                        THEN COALESCE ( v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        /
        -- Here we sum the total time    
        SUM 
            (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status
            )
    ) * 100 AS uptime_mins_percent
FROM 
    v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_vms
        ON 
            (
                v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we get only high availability vms
    v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.high_availability = TRUE
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    AND v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )

panels.title: Cluster High Availability Virtual Machine Uptime (DR13)

panels.description: Average CPU and memory peaks per host for the specific cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR28 - This query returns the
-- average cpu and memory peaks per host
-- for the specific cluster

SELECT
    host_id,
    host_name,
    AVG ( cpu_peak ) AS avg_cpu_peak,
    AVG ( mem_peak ) AS avg_mem_peak
FROM 
    (
        -- Calculation of samples cpu and memory usage peaks
        SELECT
            v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
            v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name,
            MAX ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_peak,
            MAX ( memory_usage_percent ) AS mem_peak
        FROM 
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
            INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                        v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
            AND v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
            v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name,
            DATE_TRUNC ( 'hour', v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.history_datetime )
    ) AS tbl_samples_peaks
GROUP BY host_id, host_name

panels.title: Cluster Summary of Host Resource Peaks (DR28)

panels.description: CPU and memory usage for the top 5 busiest hosts.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR23 - This query returns the
-- cpu and memory usage for the
-- top 5 busiest hosts in the specific cluster

SELECT
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name,
    AVG ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_usage_percent_avg,
    MAX ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_usage_percent_max,
    AVG ( memory_usage_percent ) AS memory_usage_percent_avg,
    MAX ( memory_usage_percent ) AS memory_usage_percent_max
FROM 
    v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
        ON 
            (
                v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we get only active hosts
    v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    AND v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
GROUP BY
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name
ORDER BY
    AVG ( cpu_usage_percent ) +
    MAX ( cpu_usage_percent ) +
    AVG ( memory_usage_percent ) +
    MAX ( memory_usage_percent ) 
    DESC
LIMIT 5

panels.title: Cluster Top 5 Busiest Hosts (DR23)

panels.description: Average number of CPU Cores for the hosts and virtual machines in the specific cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR14 - This query returns the
-- average number of CPU Cores and memory
-- for the hosts and vms in the specific cluster.

-- Hosts total CPU cores
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    'Total Hosts CPU Cores' AS entity,
    -- Calculation of samples total hosts CPU cores 
    SUM 
        (
            COALESCE ( v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.number_of_cores, 0 ) 
            *
            minutes_in_status
        ) 
    / SUM ( minutes_in_status ) AS cpu_cores
FROM 
    v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts
        ON 
            (
                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id =
                v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_configuration_version
            )
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts AS a
        ON 
            (
                a.host_id =
                v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we get only active hosts
    v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    AND a.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )

UNION ALL

-- Vms total CPU cores 
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    'Total VMs CPU Cores' AS entity,
    SUM ( nested_query.cpu_cores ) AS cpu_cores_total
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            a.vm_id,
            -- Calculation of samples vms CPU cores 
            SUM 
                (
                    COALESCE ( v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cpu_per_socket, 0 )
                    *
                    COALESCE ( v4_3_configuration_history_vms.number_of_sockets, 0 )
                    *
                    minutes_in_status
                ) / SUM ( minutes_in_status ) AS cpu_cores
        FROM 
            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id =
                        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_configuration_version
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_vms AS a
                ON 
                    (
                        a.vm_id =
                        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we get only active vms
            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
            AND a.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS uuid )
        GROUP BY a.vm_id
    ) AS nested_query

panels.title: Cluster Virtual Machine CPU Overcommit (DR14)

panels.description: Average memory for the hosts and virtual machines in the specific cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR14 - This query returns the
-- average number of CPU cores and memory
-- for the hosts and vms in the specific cluster.

-- Hosts total memory
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    'Total Hosts Memory' AS entity,
    -- Calculation of samples total hosts memory 
    SUM (
        COALESCE ( v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.memory_size_mb, 0 ) 
        *
        minutes_in_status
        ) 
    / SUM ( minutes_in_status ) AS mem_avg
FROM 
    v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts
        ON 
            (
                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id =
                v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_configuration_version
            )
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts AS a
        ON 
            (
                a.host_id =
                v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we get only active hosts
    v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    AND a.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )

UNION ALL

-- Vms total memory
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    'Total VMs Memory' AS entity,
    SUM ( nested_query.mem_avg ) AS mem_avg_total
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            a.vm_id,
            -- Calculation of samples vms memory  
            SUM 
                (
                    COALESCE ( v4_3_configuration_history_vms.memory_size_mb, 0 ) 
                    *
                    minutes_in_status
                ) / SUM ( minutes_in_status ) AS mem_avg
        FROM 
            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id =
                        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_configuration_version
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_vms AS a
                ON 
                    (
                        a.vm_id =
                        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we get only active vms
            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
            AND a.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS uuid )
        GROUP BY a.vm_id
) AS nested_query

panels.title: Cluster Virtual Machine Memory Overcommit (DR14)

panels.description: This report displays the total uptime and planned downtime percentage for the 5 high availability virtual machines that have the lowest uptime.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR20 - This query returns for 5 high availability vms,
-- that have the least uptime percent,
-- the total uptime and planned downtime percent per vm.

SELECT
    v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id, 
    v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.vm_name,
    (
        -- Calculation of samples vm uptime 
        SUM 
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_status = 1
                        THEN COALESCE ( v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        / SUM ( v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status )
    ) * 100 AS uptime_percent,
    (
        -- Calculation of samples vm planned downtime 
        SUM 
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_status IN ( 0, 2 )
                        THEN COALESCE ( v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        / SUM ( v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status )
    ) * 100 AS planned_downtime_percent
FROM 
    v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_vms
        ON 
            (
                v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
    -- Here we get only high availability vms
    AND v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.high_availability = TRUE
GROUP BY
    -- For the calculations to be per vm 
    v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id,
    v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.vm_name
ORDER BY uptime_percent ASC
LIMIT 5

panels.title: Top Five High Availability Virtual Machines Downtime (DR20)

panels.description: This report displays the total uptime and planned and unplanned downtime percentage for the 5 hosts that have the lowest uptime.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR18 - This query returns for 5 hosts,
-- that have the least uptime percent, 
-- the total uptime, planned and unplanned 
-- downtime percent per host.

SELECT
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name,
    (
        -- Calculation of samples host uptime 
        SUM 
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
                        THEN COALESCE ( v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        / SUM ( v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status )
    ) * 100 AS uptime_percent,
    (
        -- Calculation of samples host planned downtime 
        SUM 
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 2
                        THEN COALESCE ( v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        / SUM ( v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status )
    ) * 100 AS planned_downtime_percent,
    (
        -- Calculation of samples host unplanned downtime 
        SUM 
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 3
                        THEN COALESCE ( v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        /
        SUM ( v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status )
    ) * 100 AS unplanned_downtime_percent
FROM 
    v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
        ON 
            (
                v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
GROUP BY
    -- For the calculations to be per host
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name
ORDER BY
    uptime_percent ASC,
    unplanned_downtime_percent DESC,
    planned_downtime_percent DESC
LIMIT 5

panels.title: Top Five Hosts Downtime (DR18)
